sub_topic: Calculating the percent composition of inorganic compounds
message_1: What is the percent composition of sodium chloride (NaCl) if it contains 6.95 g of sodium and 10.55 g of chlorine?
message_2:
To find the percent composition of sodium chloride (NaCl), we first need to determine the total mass of the compound and then find the mass percentage of each element.

1. Calculate the total mass of the compound:
Total mass = mass of sodium + mass of chlorine
Total mass = 6.95 g (sodium) + 10.55 g (chlorine)
Total mass = 17.50 g

2. Calculate the mass percentage of each element:
Mass percentage of sodium (Na) = (mass of sodium / total mass) × 100
Mass percentage of Na = (6.95 g / 17.50 g) × 100
Mass percentage of Na ≈ 39.71%

Mass percentage of chlorine (Cl) = (mass of chlorine / total mass) × 100
Mass percentage of Cl = (10.55 g / 17.50 g) × 100
Mass percentage of Cl ≈ 60.29%

The percent composition of sodium chloride (NaCl) is approximately 39.71% sodium (Na) and 60.29% chlorine (Cl).
